contentrichtext.text: '''Zbylut Twardowski''' is a [[Poland|Polish]]-[[United States|American]] [[nephrologist]], known for his pioneering work on [[dialysis]]. He was born in a Polish town in what is now [[Ukraine]]. Widespread adoption of his patented [[catheters]] for dialysis resulted in a significant decrease in infections among kidney patients, and his devices are commonly found in hospitals and dialysis centers worldwide. Twardowski is associated with the Department of [[Internal Medicine]] at the [[University of Missouri]] at Columbia. ==External links== *[http://intmed.muhealth.org/profiles/neph/twardowski.html Bio at University of Missouri] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Twardowski, Zbylut | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American nephrologist | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Twardowski, Zbylut}} [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Polish physicians]] [[Category:Polish emigrants to the United States]] [[Category:University of Missouri faculty]] {{Poland-scientist-stub}} {{Med-bio-stub}}
